LIES
gj adc got fed but you don't have a tank.
With Janna **YOU ARE THE TANK**
So Poppy's not a tank?
she can't really start fights. a full SG team would mostly rely on picks and poke to win fights, as well as poppy summarily repulsing divers
She can, she's more of a Warden though. A defensive tank. She uses her anti-dash W to protect her allies from assassins, her E to push them away/into walls, and her ult to shoot them back to base.

She's actually a vanguard. Like Leona or a more tanky J4, she recklessly charges into the fray to cause as much trouble as possible and tank damage. Wardens, like Braum or Tahm Kench, focus on blocking shots for thier allies and don't really get in there so much as they occasionally slap the enemy team.
Poppy is listed as a Warden.
Where does it say this?
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/3A5uuBw7-champion-subclass-list
Then I must have been playing her wrong the entire time and it was working pretty well.
The thing with CC and tanks is that it rarely can only be used one way.  Sion is a vanguard but he can pull off being a warden really well.
Is called "The Undead _Juggernaut_", is not a juggernaut.

Tank mastery 7 title: **Juggernaut**.

Riot: We want to enforce _Clarity_.  **Clarity** 

Riot is bad at naming shit.
They also renamed the Assassin class as "Slayer" and put assassin into the subclass. Yet they still don't call anyone a "Slayer".
The one that turned him into an off-tank.

> [{quoted}](name=AbsorbantTNT,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=G93EBIXF,comment-id=00040001000100000000000000000000000000000001000000000001,timestamp=2016-10-10T01:09:45.872+0000)
>
> But because his entire kit revolves around a health-based passive, he's now called a Fighter (secondary tank). Although Skaarl was a cool idea, it probably should have been put on _anyone_ else.

Eh, it's just his defensive steroid.
But because his entire kit revolves around a health-based passive, he's now called a Fighter (secondary tank). Although Skaarl was a cool idea, it probably should have been put on _anyone_ else.
Though they did refer to Kled as a "skirmisher" which is nice.
Shen is the same way. I often play him aggressive.

Classification of the Poppy skins:

Battle Regalia: Plays Poppy occasionally. Second, perhaps third, main.
Ragdoll/Blacksmith: The ones that, if anyone has, nobody really uses.
Scarlet Hammer: Poppy main, this person knows what they're doing.
Lollipoppy: Played Poppy pre-rework, hardly plays her now.
Star Guardian: Support main (mage-style supports such as Lulu and Sona) probably has no idea how to play a frontline tank and/or fighter. Free lane.

EDIT: Noxus Poppy: Throw this in with Ragdoll and Blacksmith.
Noxus Poppy?

Noxus Poppy: They saw this picture of her:

https://i.imgflip.com/1c1g3p.jpg

SO what am I?
I own Blacksmith, Scarlet Hammer, Battle Regalia and Noxus
A Morde main

You realize that Star Guardian Poppy has the most armor out of all the Star Guardians right?

As a top lane tank main, I take offense to being called a support main just because I like the skin.
You are joking, right? Because you can never tell if someone is being serious or not concerning text.

Eh, I guess I just don't like the idea of star guardian poppy not considered an actual tank. 

Honestly I shouldn't care what others think.
No big deal.
